title.narrative: Regional and Local Roads Program Support Project

description.narrative: The Regional and Local Roads Program Support project for Macedonia objectives will be achieved mostly by improving the condition and quality of a part of the network of regional and local roads. The primary target group are road users in general, whose cost of using the roads will be reduced. The project activities will include: (i) physical works to improve road conditions, thereby reducing road user costs in the short term; and (ii) broader institutional support to improve overall road management in the country, thereby reducing road user costs in the medium and longer term. There are three components to the project. The first component is the rehabilitation and periodic maintenance of regional roads. This component will provide funding to cover about 330 km of paved road sections in the 2008 - 2012 periods (about 8.7percent of all regional roads). It will include civil works which can mostly be characterized as localized repairs, periodic maintenance and light rehabilitation. It has been agreed that the road sections to be included in this component will be those which have been selected through a recent European Commission (EC)-financed study carried out by the consulting firm Hydroplan.The preparation of bidding documents and the supervision of works will be financed from Fund for National and Regional Roads (FNRR's) regular resources as a contribution to the Program. The second component is the rehabilitation and periodic maintenance of local roads. This component will provide funding to cover about 420 km of paved and unpaved local roads over the 2008 - 2012 period (about 5 percent of all Local roads) selected by the municipalities. It will include civil works for localized repairs or replacement of structural layers and drainage structures, followed by partial or full asphalt resurfacing or regravelling. condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Guarantee Agreement Section 2.02 | Description :The Guarantor specifically undertakes, whenever there isreasonable cause to believe that the funds available to the Borrower will be inadequate to meet the estimated expenditures requiredfor the carrying out of the project, promptly to provide the Borrower withthe funds needed to meet such expenditures. | Frequency:Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Guarantee Agreement Section 2.03a | Description :The Guarantor further specifically undertakes to ensure theBorrower maintains adequate staff and resources and adequate management, in a manner and with terms of reference and a compositionsatisfactory to the Bank. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Guarantee Agreement Section 2.03b | Description :The Guarantor shall transfer to the Borrower no less thentwenty (20) percent of the total excise tax on oil derivatives (as defined in the Guarantor's Law Amending the Law on PublicRoads-Official Gazette 168/2012), collected within each calendar quarter; such transfers being on a regular basis at least fourtimes during a calendar year, in intervals not exceeding three calendar months. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section I.A.1 | Description :The Borrower shall be responsible for day-to-day Project implementationand for procurement, financial management, disbursement andmonitoring, and reporting for the entire Project. To that end, theBorrower shall maintain adequate staff and resources, in a mannersatisfactory to the Bank, and shall maintain adequate management,with terms of reference and a composition satisfactory to the Bank. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section I.A.3 | Description :The Borrower shall by July 31, 2013, have submitted a proposal for aFive-year Strategic Program for the period 2013-2017 for adoption by Government, and update such plan on a yearly basis. The annualprogram and budget of the Borrower for each respective year shall be consistent with such strategic program for that respectiveyear. | Due Date :02-Dec-2013

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section I.A.3 | Description :The Borrower shall select the local roads to be improved under Part IIof the Project based on proposals made by municipalities, and in accordance with the Project Operational Manual. | Frequency:Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section I.A.3 | Description :The Borrower shall within eighteen (18) months of the Effective Date,have completed implementation of an enterprise resources planning system, in form and scope satisfactory to the Bank. | Due Date:25-Jan-2015

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section I.A.3 | Description :The Borrower shall within twelve (12) months of the Effective Date,have: (i) completed a road inventory and condition survey of its core road network; and (ii) established a road asset managementsystem for its road network, each in form, substance and scope satisfactory to the Bank. | Due Date :25-Jul-2014
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section I.D.1 | Description :Beginning December 31, 2013, the Borrower shall keep its debt serviceratio at at least 1.2. | Frequency :Quarterly
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section I.D.2 | Description :Beginning December 31, 2013, the Borrower shall keep its current ratioat not less than 1.0. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section II.B.4 | Description :The Borrower shall have its entity financial statements audited byindependent auditors acceptable to the Bank, in accordance with consistently applied auditing standards acceptable to the Bank.Each audit of these financial statements shall cover the period of one fiscal year of the Borrower to be submitted no later thansix months after this period and made publicly available. | Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: Approximately 284 km of Regional Roads improved by the end of the project.
Approximately 420 km of Local Roads improved by the end of the project.
Vehicle operation costs on the roads improved under the Project have decreased by at least 10 percent.

actual.value: 89% of life cycle analysis. Target met.

title.narrative: The PESR has successfully managed and implemented the investments under the Regional and Local Roads Program.

actual.value: Yes. Generally, PESR continues to demonstrate good discharge of its responsibilities.

title.narrative: Regular Technical Audits have confirmed that road works comply with contractual specifications.
Road Asset Management System has been used to produce Five-year rolling Strategic Program.

actual.value: The Strategic Program is in preparation, all prerequisites fulfilled and data available.

title.narrative: EU guidelines successfully applied in the design of road signs and road markings on the regional road network.
Financial module of Enterprise Respourse Planning System operational
Design of traffic signs and road markings for regional roads completed and implemented on regional roads rehabilitated under the project.
Road Asset Management System established and operational.
Road Condition Survey on core road network conducted
